intro: Betckea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable betcha, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from linear to ovate. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Betckea heterophylla is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal or inland environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
